Cancer Code¶

Below is a skeleton of the code contained in the code.cancer.py file. Below should be summaries of the contents, as well as links to the source itself.

Cells¶

Cancer cells are represented by the Cell class, each cell has a CellType

CellType Class¶

class code.cancer.CellType(name, type_ind, k, L, color='b')[source]¶

A holder for some cell type information

Initialization / Attributes:
  • name : string name of cell type
  • type_ind : an int for the cell type
  • k : spring constant (float)
  • L : natural length of bonds (float)
  • color=’b’ : set the color the plots

Cell Class¶

class code.cancer.Cell(pos, cell_type, index=0)[source]¶

A cell object

Initialization / Attributes:
  • pos: a position array
  • type: a type declaration, instance of CellType class
  • vel: a velocity arrays
  • index: an integer index for finding the cell in a big position array

GhostCell Class¶

class code.cancer.GhostCell(original, sign=1, xsize=20)[source]¶

A ghost cell, which is used to implement periodic boundary conditions. A ghost cell is linked to its parent.

Initialization:
  • original: parent cell
  • sign: either 1 or -1
  • xsize: size of box, size of offset
update()[source]¶

Update the position of the GhostCell based on the offset and sign

Links¶

I wrote a little code to facilitate the storage of links between cells

Link Class¶

class code.cancer.Link(one, two, L=None, k=None, xsize=20)[source]¶

A link object keeps a link between two cells.

Initialization:
  • one: cell one
  • two: cell two
  • L: resting length of link_disp
  • k: strength of link_disp
  • xsize: size of box (to handle periodic boundary conditions)
Properties:
  • disp - displacement of spring
  • extension - compute the current link extension
  • energy - compute the current link energy
  • force - force of spring
disp[source]¶

Displacement from one to two

energy[source]¶

Get the energy stored in a link

extension[source]¶

Get the current extension of the link

force[source]¶

Get the force the link enacts

Links Class¶

class code.cancer.Links[source]¶

Container for Links

Main Attributes:
  • data : holds links, a dictionary where for a pair of cells holds a pointer to the Link for those two cells
  • neighbors : holds neighbor information, a dictionary that for each cell stores a set of its neighbors.

This class basically a wrapper for the builtin dictionary, such that accessing its arguments is independent of order.

add_link(one, two, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Add a link between cells one and two

get_link(one, two)[source]¶

Get the link between cells one and two, order independent

get_neighbors(cell)[source]¶

Get the neighbors of cell cell

remove_cell(cell)[source]¶

Remove all references to a cell, both links and neighbors

remove_link(one, two)[source]¶

Remove a link between cells one and two

CancerSim Class¶

The main cancer simulation class

class code.cancer.CancerSim(boxsize=(20, 20), basal_height=10.0, seed=None, xi=2.0, a=0.1)[source]¶

The main Cancer Simulation Class.

Creates an array of Cells, allows for the designation of cancer cells And the evolution of the cells thereafter.

add_bond(one, two)[source]¶

Add a bond between cells one and two

add_cancer_cell(x, r, eps=None)[source]¶

randomly make a cell a cancer cell

add_cell(cell)[source]¶

Add the cell: cell

delaunay()[source]¶

Delaunay routine, sets the initial links

duplicate_cancer_cell(cancer=None, disp_frac=0.15)[source]¶

Duplicate the cancer cell: cancer

energy[source]¶

get the energy of the current configuration

fire(fmax=0.1, Nmin=5.0, finc=1.1, fdec=0.5, alphastart=0.1, fa=0.99, deltatmax=10.0, maxsteps=100000)[source]¶

Do a fire relaxation

force_func(x1, x2)[source]¶

the native force function between two positions

forces[source]¶

get the forces between cells, as array, both from links and from the native force_func

get_neighbors(cell)[source]¶

Get the linked neighbor cells of cell

get_pos_arr(force=False)[source]¶

Get an array of all of the cell positions

jiggle(sigma=0.1, ghosts=True)[source]¶

Jiggle the atom positions

plot_cells(clf=True, fignum=1, ghosts=False, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot the current configuration

plot_links(clf=False, cutoff=None, fignum=1, ghosts=False, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot the links between cells

remove_bond(one, two)[source]¶

Remove a bond between cells one and two

remove_cell(cell)[source]¶

Remove the cell: cell, and all bonds for that cell

time_step()[source]¶

Run a time step, duplicate a cancer cell, do a FIRE relaxation, and plot
